TopicTitle: idea - mechanics of collision of asteroids, comets with the planet and options for their deviation from the course.

Articles.Content: Hello everyone, I don't know if this topic was raised, but this may be interesting. I suggest adding small randomly generated comets, asteroids that will either orbit the planet or its satellite, or just in space. In the first option, which I will develop, it is assumed that the asteroid can either itself or with our help descend and collide with the planet's surface, with the corresponding physics and plasma animation. After it collides with the planet, black, gray soot may appear + if the asteroid is large, then a pit of a certain size. In principle, everything, if you have any questions or clarifications, I will be happy to answer

This already exists in KSP 1, where there are asteroids floating around space and orbiting Dres that you can move around with a big enough rocket. We’re not sure if deformable terrain will be included, although from the most recent dev video it looks like the terrain platform can handle the addition of new terrain deformations because all of the textures are generated based on slope. Plasma during reentry is also a part of KSP 1
